revised_title: Aspects of the Chemistry of Ozone Depletion: Pathways of Pollutants in the Atmosphere
tldr: This article discusses the chemical processes that destroy stratospheric ozone, focusing on the uncertainties of predicting ozone depletions and atmospheric measurements of trace species. It highlights the importance of understanding the reactions of hydroperoxy in the ozone depletion process and the impact of new laboratory studies on estimating the depletion of stratospheric ozone by various pollutants, such as chlorofluoromethanes and nitrogen oxides.
